data: Cancer antigen 15-3 (CA15-3) is a protein made by a variety of cells, particularly breast cancer cells.
The protein moves into the blood, where it can be measured.
CA15-3 is a tumour marke and is used to check how breast cancer treatment is working and look for cancer that has come back, or recurred, after treatment.
CA15-3 levels are higher than normal in most women with breast cancer that has spread to other parts of the body (called metastatic breast cancer).
Not all types of breast cancer will cause CA 15-3 levels to rise, as some types of cancer cells dont over-produce the antigen.
